content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-263-08-B |Item_parent=Vascular nephropathy |Item_parent_short=Vascular nephropathy |Rank=B |Title=Diagnosis of renal artery stenosis |Angio-CT/MRI: number of renal arteries, location of stenoses, morphological study of the kidneys and the aorta (state of the wall) and the iliac axes; |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors=Jean-Jacques Boffa |Order=8}} Diagnostic tests {| class="wikitable" |'''Examination''' |'''Interest''' |Limitations |- |'''Renal ultrasound'''' |Kidney size asymmetry | |- |Renal Artery Doppler |Easily available. Good sensitivity. Flow analysis (degree of stenosis). Measurement of resistance indexes (predictive of response to treatment). |Obese subjects. Radiologist's experience. |- |'''Spiral computed tomography'''' |Direct visualisation of the renal arteries (trunk + dividing branches). Demonstration of calcifications. Good definition |Large quantities of iodinated contrast products (renal toxicity). Irradiation. |- |'''Angio-MRI'''' |Direct visualisation of the renal arteries. No renal toxicity (gadolinium). |More restricted access. Overestimation of lesions. |- |Renal arteriography |Reference examination. Diagnostic and therapeutic interest. |Iodine injection (renal toxicity). Cholesterol crystal emboli. |}
